title: Senior Data Scientist
description:
The Corporate Decision Sciences team at NBCUniversal helps drive advanced analytics by building and integrating pragmatic data science principles and products throughout the Company. The Team focuses primarily on decision science analyses to support and inform strategy and key business decisions and building advanced data products to help enable more data-enhanced decision support.

Be part of a team of Data Scientists that focus on the design and execution of advanced analytical data exploration, mining, inference, models, and systems utilizing multiple traditional and non-traditional media measurement data sets. The Senior Data Scientist will work closely with internal clients, Data Scientists, Data Engineers, and IT across all NBCUniversal businesses. The position reports to a Director of Data Science.

Responsibilities
Develop and deliver high-impact tools and insights comprised of aggregated data sets and advanced algorithms with a clean user experience
Drive the collection and manipulation of new data and the refinement of existing data sources
Manage multiple priorities across a mix of ad-hoc and operational projects
Translate complex problems and solutions to all levels of the organization
Qualifications/Requirements


2+ years of experience in Data Science, advanced analytics or similar experience in academia applying statistical methods (i.e., parametric and non-parametric regression, time-series, panel data analysis, survival analysis, etc.) and machine learning techniques (i.e., methods of supervised and unsupervised learning such as clustering, regression, classification, ensemble methods, etc.) with high levels of proficiency
Advanced Degree (Master’s or PhD) with a specialization in Statistics, Computer Science, Data Science, Economics, Mathematics, Operations Research or other quantitative field or equivalent
2+ years of experience with time-series forecasting methods and applications
2+ years of experience with data visualization techniques and concepts
1+ years of experience using relational databases and SQL
1+ years of experience using cluster computing environments and Spark, Hive and/or Hadoop
Desired Characteristics


Expert knowledge of R and Python, additional languages (i.e., Julia, Java, Scala) a plus
Team-oriented and collaborative approach with a demonstrated aptitude and willingness to learn new methods and tools
Advanced knowledge of econometric methods for inference and prediction
Knowledge and experience with Bayesian statistics and applications
Experience with television ratings and digital measurement tools (Nielsen, Rentrak, comScore, Omniture, etc.)
Experience with large-scale video assets
Experience with computer vision and metadata generation from video
